snippet: Even as some 39,000 customers had received the all-clear signal by Tuesday, after a chemical spill last week contaminated tap water, many feared drinking and cooking with it.
abstract: Many residents of Charleston, W Va, still fear drinking and cooking with tap water, even after receiving all-clear signal following contamination from chemical spill into Elk River; West Virginia American Water company, along with state health officials, has assured residents water became safe to drink once the chemical, known as MCHM, became diluted to less than one part per million.
lead_paragraph: Even as some 39,000 customers had received the all-clear signal by Tuesday, after a chemical spill last week contaminated tap water, many feared drinking and cooking with it.

headline.main: Return to Normal in Parts of West Virginia Is Marred by Distrust
headline.print_headline: Return to Normal in Parts of West Virginia Is Marred by Distrust
